1.global: The act of taking in water by mouth to hydrate or quench thirst.

hands.desc: Holding a cup or bottle and bringing it to the mouth.

legs.desc: No significant movement of the legs.

torso.desc: Slight forward lean to bring the cup to the mouth.

2.global: The action of consuming food for sustenance, nourishment, or pleasure.

hands.desc: Holding food or utensils for eating.

legs.desc: Seated or standing, legs typically stationary.

torso.desc: Torso typically remains upright, slight head motion while eating.

3.global: The act of cleaning teeth and gums using a toothbrush and toothpaste for oral hygiene.

hands.desc: Holding the toothbrush and moving it across the teeth.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, usually standing.

torso.desc: Head and torso might slightly tilt to ensure brushing angles.

4.global: Using a brush or comb to groom and style hair.

hands.desc: Holding the brush or comb, pulling through hair.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, typically seated or standing.

torso.desc: Head movement to guide the brush along the hair.

5.global: Releasing an object from one's grasp, allowing it to fall to the ground or another surface.

hands.desc: Releasing the object from the hand.

legs.desc: No movement of legs.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, just a natural release of the object.

6.global: Lifting or grasping an object with one's hands.

hands.desc: Grasping the object and lifting it.

legs.desc: Legs bend to allow bending down to pick up the object.

torso.desc: Torso might bend slightly forward during the action.

7.global: Projecting an object through the air using the hand or arm.

hands.desc: Holding the object and extending the arm to release it.

legs.desc: Legs may assist with the momentum for a stronger throw.

torso.desc: Torso rotation assists in the throw's force.

8.global: Moving from a standing position to a seated position.

hands.desc: Hands may help balance while sitting.

legs.desc: Bending the legs to lower the body into a seated position.

torso.desc: Torso flexes forward slightly to facilitate the action.

9.global: Transitioning from a seated position to an upright position by pushing up with the legs.

hands.desc: Hands may be placed on the knees or floor to assist in standing.

legs.desc: Legs push upward to lift the body into a standing position.

torso.desc: Torso rises as the legs straighten, potentially leaning forward to balance.

10.global: Striking one's palms together to make a sound, typically as a form of applause or approval.

hands.desc: Clapping hands together, rapidly bringing palms together and apart.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary with no involvement in the clapping action.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, possibly a slight bend or rhythm for effect.

11.global: Interpreting and understanding written or printed words and symbols.

hands.desc: Holding the book or reading material.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, usually seated.

torso.desc: Torso and head slightly bent forward to focus on the material.

12.global: Using a pen, pencil, or other writing tool to create letters, words, or symbols on a surface.

hands.desc: Holding and moving the writing tool to create symbols on a surface.

legs.desc: Typically stationary, seated or standing.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright with occasional shifts for comfort.

13.global: Ripping apart paper into smaller pieces with the hands.

hands.desc: Gripping the paper and tearing it into pieces.

legs.desc: No significant movement from the legs.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright with minimal movement.

14.global: The act of putting on a jacket to cover the upper body and arms.

hands.desc: Reaching to pull the jacket's sleeves onto the arms.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, typically standing.

torso.desc: Torso motion to slip the arms into the jacket and pull it over the shoulders.

15.global: Removing a jacket from the body, typically by pulling it off the arms.

hands.desc: Grabbing the jacket's edges to pull it off the body.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary during the action.

torso.desc: Torso rotates or leans to assist in removing the jacket.

16.global: The act of putting a shoe onto one's foot for protection or fashion.

hands.desc: Grabbing and positioning the shoe onto the foot.

legs.desc: Foot remains stationary while the other foot is lifted to place the shoe.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement to assist in balancing the body during the action.

17.global: Removing a shoe from one's foot using one's hands.

hands.desc: Using the hands to grip and remove the shoe from the foot.

legs.desc: Foot lifted to assist in removing the shoe.

torso.desc: No significant torso movement, only slight balancing to assist the removal.

18.global: Placing eyeglasses or spectacles on the face to correct vision or protect the eyes.

hands.desc: Holding and positioning the glasses onto the face.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary.

torso.desc: Head remains still while positioning glasses on the face.

19.global: Removing eyeglasses from one's face with one's hands.

hands.desc: Gripping and lifting the glasses off the face.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, only slight head tilt for better access.

20.global: Placing a hat or cap on the head for protection or fashion.

hands.desc: Reaching and placing the hat/cap onto the head.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary, typically standing.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement to adjust for placing the hat.
